intro: Lomaria amabilis, commonly known as the sweet lomaria, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color, arranged in a dense cluster. Lomaria amabilis thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in high-altitude grasslands. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem.
